title: Centralize and display all money values in INR (₹) across the app

requirements.summary: Ensure every UI location that displays money shows INR using the ₹ symbol across storefront, cart/checkout, orders, and admin/nursery management views.
acceptanceCriteria: Product prices in ProductCard (frontend/src/components/store/ProductCard.tsx) render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
Product price in ProductDetailsPage (frontend/src/pages/ProductDetailsPage.tsx) renders in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
CartPage (frontend/src/pages/CartPage.tsx) line-item prices, subtotals, and totals render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
CheckoutPage (frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx) item prices and total render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
MyOrdersPage (frontend/src/pages/MyOrdersPage.tsx) per-item prices and order totals render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).

Admin/Nursery views that show prices (e.g., products lists in admin nursery management, and any other admin/nursery product lists/forms that display a computed currency string) render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).

file_operations.description: Replace the hard-coded USD string interpolation for product price with the shared INR money-formatting utility so the card always renders ₹ with consistent formatting.
Refactor the product price display to use the shared INR money-formatting utility (₹), removing the current $-prefixed manual formatting.
Update cart line-item unit prices, line totals, subtotal, and total to use the shared INR money-formatting utility (₹) instead of manual $ templates.
Update checkout item unit prices, item totals, and overall total to use the shared INR money-formatting utility (₹) consistently.
Update per-item price-per-item display and order total display to use the shared INR money-formatting utility (₹), removing existing $ formatting.
Refactor any computed currency strings in product list rows (and anywhere else on the page) to use the shared INR money-formatting utility for consistent ₹ formatting.
Refactor any product price displays and any computed currency strings in nursery product management views to use the shared INR money-formatting utility (ensure no $ remains).

requirements.summary: Introduce a single reusable frontend INR formatter for integer cents/paise and refactor UI to use it instead of duplicated manual formatting.
acceptanceCriteria: A single reusable formatting helper is introduced and used wherever currency is displayed, rather than duplicating "$" string templates in components/pages.
Formatting uses INR with the ₹ symbol and shows two decimal places consistently for integer cents/paise inputs.
No user-facing currency strings in the app UI contain the "$" symbol after the change.

file_operations.description: Create a shared money-formatting utility that formats an integer cents/paise value into INR using Intl.NumberFormat (English locale) with ₹ and consistent 2-decimal output.
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for price rendering (remove manual "$...toFixed(2)" usage).
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for the product price display (remove manual "$...toFixed(2)" usage).
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for all displayed monetary amounts in the cart (unit prices, line totals, subtotal, total).
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for all displayed monetary amounts in checkout (per-item and total).
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for displayed monetary amounts in order history (per-item and totals).
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for any displayed prices in admin product management, replacing any ad-hoc currency formatting.
Import and use the shared INR formatter helper for any displayed prices in nursery management views, replacing any ad-hoc currency formatting.
